p: Nanotechnology is defined as the application of particles with dimension(s) of roughly 1 to 100 nm scale by the National Nanotechnology Initiative [ 63]. The principal mechanisms of particle deposition in the respiratory tract depend on particle size; for larger particles, impaction and sedimentation are important, but for nanoparticles less than 160 nm in diameter, diffusion represents the principal mechanism. Hence, nanoparticles and micro-particles approaches provide a broad range of opportunities for COVID-19 with new solutions for clinical problems [ 64].
